body:
It would be very useful to have a hook for executing regression tests.

### Rationale

It would be very useful to have a standard hook for executing regression tests in a package.  That way package installers can have a standard command to run a regression test

### Description

This is part of the key4hep project which is using spack to create an overlay system.  It would be useful to have hooks in spack that would present a standard command to run a regression test for a package.  This command should allow for different levels of regression testing.    The goal would be to allow for a standard command that would run a regression test for a package.

### Additional information

It would be similar to the %check directive of rpm

Also regression testing is particularly important/useful since we are often making different versions. Also regression testing frameworks can be used for performance testing which becomes important when dealing with different compiler flags.

### General information

This seems as if it would be easy to implement.  The tricky parts is to come to some agreement about the API for the regression testing hooks.
title: add hooks for regression testing
